IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO PROMOTE THE HEALTH, DEVELOPMENT AND WELL-BEING OF CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE, A HOME AWAY FROM HOME FOR FAMILIES OF SERIOUSLY ILL CHILDREN, AND BY CREATING AND SUPPORTING PROGRAMS THAT DIRECTLY IMPROVE THE LIVES OF CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION PROMOTES THE HEALTH, DEVELOPMENT AND WELL-BEING OF CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH THE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE, A HOME AWAY FROM HOME FOR FAMILIES OF SERIOUSLY ILL CHILDREN, AND BY CREATING AND SUPPORTING PROGRAMS THAT DIRECTLY IMPROVE THE LIVES OF CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES.
IRS990.Description: RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE CHARITIES OF THE CAPITAL REGION OWNS AND OPERATES THE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE OF ALBANY. THE SIXTEEN BEDROOM FACILITY PROVIDES TEMPORARY HOUSING TO FAMILIES OF SERIOUSLY ILL CHILDREN WHO MUST LEAVE THEIR OWN COMMUNITY TO SEEK MEDICAL CARE FOR THEIR CHILD. THE HOUSE SERVES CHILDREN RECEIVING TREATMENT AT ALBANY MEDICAL CENTER, ST. PETER'S HOSPITAL, ALBANY MEMORIAL HOSPITAL, ST. MARGARET MARY'S AND OTHER MEDICAL FACILITIES. IN 2010 RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE OF ALBANY SERVED 362 FAMILIES: 91% CAME FROM NYS, WITH THE REMAINING FROM 10 OTHER STATES AS WELL AS 2 OTHER COUNTRIES. FAMILIES OF SERIOUSLY ILL CHILDREN AGE 18 AND UNDER ARE ELIGIBLE TO STAY AT RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE. WE ASK A NOMINAL DONATION OF $10 PER NIGHT PER FAMILY, WHICH ONLY PARTIALLY DEFRAYS THE COST OF OPERATING THE HOUSE AND NO FAMILY IS EVER TURNED AWAY DUE TO LACK OF FUNDS. MORE THAN $96,000 OF IN-KIND DONATIONS OF GOODS AND SERVICES WERE RECEIVED IN 2010 COVERING PROGRAM EXPENSES THAT THE CHARITY WOULD OTHERWISE HAVE TO PAY. MAJOR IN-KIND DONATIONS INCLUDE FOOD, SOFT DRINKS, MILK, CLEANING SUPPLIES AND HOUSEHOLD PAPER GOODS. A GROUP OF OVER 350 VOLUNTEERS HELP SUPPORT THE STAFF, BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND GUESTS OF RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE BY PROVIDING OFFICE ASSISTANCE, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, MEAL PREPARATION FOR FAMILIES, GARDENING AND MAINTENANCE. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE CHARITIES IDENTIFIED A NEED FOR PROGRAM EXPANSION BY OPENING A RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE FAMILY ROOM IN THE PEDIATRIC INTENSIVE CARE UNIT IN ALBANY MEDICAL CENTER HOSPITAL, WHICH OPENED IN 2001. THIS SERVES BOTH LOCAL AND DISTANT FAMILIES WHO HAVE A CHILD WITH CRITICAL MEDICAL PROBLEMS. THE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE FAMILY ROOM PROVIDES A FULLY FURNISHED HOME LIKE ATMOSPHERE WITH LIVING ROOM, KITCHENETTE AND TWO SLEEPING ROOMS.

Activity2.Description: RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE CHARITIES MISSION IS TO PROVIDE COMFORT, SUPPORT AND RESPITE FOR FAMILIES OF SERIOUSLY ILL CHILDREN IN A COMPASSIONATE AND HOME-LIKE ENVIRONMENT THROUGH ITS CORNERSTONE PROGRAM, THE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE OF ALBANY, BUT CAN ONLY HELP SIXTEEN FAMILIES AT ONE TIME. TO MEET THE BROADER MISSION, RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE CHARITIES PROVIDES GRANTS IN THE COMMUNITY THAT ENHANCE THE LIVES OF CHILDREN. MONEY USED FOR GRANT MAKING COMES FROM SPECIAL PROMOTIONS HELD BY OUR LOCAL MCDONALD'S FRANCHISES, SPECIAL DESIGNATED FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES AND A MATCHING GRANT ACCOUNT FUNDED BY THE NATIONAL CHAPTER OF RMHC IN OAK BROOK. A LISTING OF 2010 IS SHOWN ON SCHEDULE I.

Activity3.Description: THE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE CHARITIES OF THE CAPITAL REGION'S RONALD MCDONALD CARE MOBILE PROGRAM IS OPERATED IN PARTNERSHIP WITH ST. PETER'S HOSPITAL. THE CARE MOBILE,A 40-FOOT LONG, 8-FOOT WIDE, STATE-OF-THE-ART VEHICLE, IS BUILT SPECIFICALLY FOR DELIVERING COMPREHENSIVE PEDIATRIC ORAL HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO CHILDREN AT THEIR SCHOOL. THE VEHICLE INCLUDES TWO PATIENT EXAMINATION ROOMS, A LABORATORY AND RECEPTION AND MEDICAL RECORDS AREAS. STAFFED WITH DENTISTS AND ORAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS FROM ST. PETER'S HOSPITAL, THE RONALD MCDONALD CARE MOBILE PROVIDES COST-EFFECTIVE, HIGH-QUALITY DENTAL AND HEALTH EDUCATION SERVICES TO UNDERSERVED CHILDREN IN ALBANY. SOCIAL WORKERS ALSO HELP ELIGIBLE FAMILIES ENROLL IN STATE AND FEDERALLY ASSISTED HEALTH INSURANCE INITIATIVES SUCH AS "HEALTHY KIDS NEW YORK." EACH YEAR, NEARLY 3,000 CHILDREN ARE SCREENED BY THE CARE MOBILE PROGRAM. OVER 1,000 CHILDREN RECEIVE COMPREHENSIVE CARE RANGING FROM CLEANINGS AND SEALANTS TO EXTRACTIONS AND ROOT CANALS. FACTS ABOUT WHY PROVIDING ACCESS TO DENTAL CARE IS SO VITAL:MORE THAN 51 MILLION HOURS OF SCHOOLING ARE LOST ANNUALLY DUE TO THE LACK OF DENTAL CARE AMONG AMERICAN CHILDREN.TOOTH DECAY IS THE MOST COMMON CHRONIC CHILDHOOD DISEASE TODAY, FIVE TIMES MORE COMMON THAN ASTHMA.THE CARE MOBILE IS ONE OF THE WAYS RMHC FULFILLS OUR MISSION TO PROMOTE THE HEALTH, DEVELOPMENT AND WELL BEING OF CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: RMHC IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND COMPARABLE NEW YORK STATE LAW AND, ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS RECORDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. RMHC HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT IT HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2010 AND 2009.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: FAMILY & CHILDREN'S SERVICES OF THE CAPITAL REGION

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING GRANTS IN THE U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: OUR COMMUNITY GRANT PROGRAM IS ONE OF OUR MOST EFFECTIVE MEANS TO ACHIEVING OUR VITAL MISSION. THE GRANT PROGRAM IS INCORPORATED THROUGHOUT OUR ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE. OUR EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE INCLUDES A VICE PRESIDENT FOR GRANTS. A 9-PERSON COMMITTEE REVIEWS POTENTIAL GRANTS TWO TIMES PER YEAR. THE COMMITTEE IS SUPPORTED BY A PART-TIME GRANT PROGRAM COORDINATOR AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE REVIEW PROCESS INCLUDES A MANDATORY SITE VISIT AND COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW OF THE POTENTIAL GRANTEES' FINANCIAL STANDING. THE COMMITTEE FOLLOWS A COMPREHENSIVE SET OF POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AS THEY REVIEW AND CONSIDER POTENTIAL GRANTS. IF FUNDING IS PROVIDED, RECIPIENTS ARE MANDATED TO EXECUTE A CONTRACT GOVERNING THE USE OF THE FUNDS AND ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE REPORT DETAILING HOW THE FUNDS WERE USED IN ORDER TO VERIFY THAT THE FUNDS WERE USED FOR THE REQUESTED PURPOSE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE NATIONAL OFFICE OF RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE CHARITIES. THE 990 IS ALSO PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR THIER REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: INDIVIDUAL COMMITTEES WORK TO ENSURE THEY ADHERE TO THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THE BOARD AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEW VOTING ITEMS IN ADVANCE FOR POSSIBLE CONFLICTS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: SALARIES ARE BENCHMARKED AT THE TIME OF HIRING AND ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY TO ENSURE COMPENSATION IS IN LINE WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S MARKET.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES COPIES OF ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:
